physical_appearance:\This is a pair of sea charts that are rectangular in shape. The title of the maps are stated at the bottom middle of the left piece of the chart
 and at the lower left hand corner of the right piece of the chart. When placed alongside one another with its breadth as the mid-point
 the sea charts form a larger image of the China sea and its islands. The scale of the maps are not indicated. Near the bottom of the left piece of the chart (2017-00052-001) at its middle
 there is a written dedication to \\Capt. D. Ross and his assistants Lieut. P. Maugham
subject_terms_1:P. Crawfurd and J. Houghton of the Bombay Marine\\. At the bottom of their respective middles islands (landforms) seas maps (documents)
subject_terms_2:both charts state \\Published by James Horsburgh prints East India Company Nautical charts Colonization China Sea Southeast Asia
subject_terms_3:hydrographer to the Honorable East India Company October 1st 1821 - According to Act of Parliament with additions to 1859\\. The sides of the maps look slightly worn out and several tears can be seen.\
subject_terms_4:colonial settlements

metadata.title_text: Pair of China Sea charts Pair of China Sea charts by James Horsburgh
metadata.physical_appearance: "This is a pair of sea charts that are rectangular in shape. The title of the maps are stated at the bottom middle of the left piece of the chart, and at the lower left hand corner of the right piece of the chart. When placed alongside one another with its breadth as the mid-point, the sea charts form a larger image of the China sea and its islands. The scale of the maps are not indicated. Near the bottom of the left piece of the chart (2017-00052-001) at its middle, there is a written dedication to ""Capt. D. Ross and his assistants Lieut. P. Maugham
metadata.subject_terms_1: P. Crawfurd and J. Houghton of the Bombay Marine"". At the bottom of their respective middles islands (landforms) seas maps (documents)
metadata.subject_terms_2: both charts state ""Published by James Horsburgh prints East India Company Nautical charts Colonization China Sea Southeast Asia
metadata.subject_terms_3: hydrographer to the Honorable East India Company October 1st 1821 - According to Act of Parliament with additions to 1859"". The sides of the maps look slightly worn out and several tears can be seen."
